intro: Potentilla crantzii var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features wiry, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided into five oval lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in meadows and rocky habitats.
